item.title: Bernoulli Experiments
item.description:
The Origin of Bernoulli Experiments

The idea of the Bernoulli experiment comes from Jacob Bernoulli, a well-known mathematician from the 17th century who was fascinated by the randomness of lifeâ€”like rolling dice or flipping coins. He wanted to understand these random processes mathematically and came up with a simple but powerful framework that described experiments with only two possible outcomes: success or failure. You can think of it like flipping a coin, where the outcome is either heads (success) or tails (failure).
